page.title: 06Cattle on Brizes Lodge Farm
page.content: Some of Brizes Lodge fields are rough grazing and they have cattle in them. The cattle come from Crawley at two months old. Some are Hereford calves, which have brown bodies and white faces. Others are crossed between a Hereford bull and a black and white Friesan cow. The calves will have a brown or a black body and always a white face. The calves are looked after until they are two years old and then go back to a Crawley farm to have calves of their own. Cows will not graze if there is too much Yorkshire fog grass, which cows don't like in the field they are in. In some places there are patches of long grass. The cow pats make the grass grow longer.
